Row.Text: Greetings! I am Mohamed Siad Barre, the man who brought freedom and prosperity to the Somali peoples.
If I must leave Somalia, I will leave buildings but not people.
God has created man and has given him the faculty of mind to choose between good and bad, between virtue and vice. It is a shame that you seem to prefer vice.
There are but few in the world who understand justice and virtue, but you seem to be one of them. Would you care to make a public Declaration of Friendship?

I shall respect an individual as long as he deserves respect, but if he turns away from the correct path, then that is not my business.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] ([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
All the people you have enslaved must become free. This is history, and no one can prevent the sunshine from reaching us.

Some of the colonizers quickly retreat, while some, because they are stupid, continue colonizing others, increasing the world's suffering, deaths, and humiliation. Your expansion suggests that you are of the second sort.
Have you come to plead for mercy, colonizer?
It is always a pleasure to meet with an ally in the struggle.
Ah, welcome back. I see you enjoy witnessing the freedom of the Somali.
Why are you here? I cannot imagine you wish to engage in a productive dialogue.
Do you think your army's grandstanding intimidates me? I have an army of my own, you know, and it is without peer.
What would you have of us?
This embarrassing result proves, once more, that the Somali fight for justice is an uphill battle against a hostile international community.
We have broken the chain of a consumer economy based on imports, but for goods like yours, we may have to make an exception.
There can be no peace until I have made you understand that Somalia cannot, and will not, be led by other people.
I did not come to power to divide the Somali but to unite them, and I will never deviate from this path. Our peoples must be free to travel and intermingle.
The Somali people will not be exploited.
In Somalia, we have chosen social justice instead of exploitation of man by man. These times have forced me to call for help; I hope you will make the same choice that we did.
Verbal rebukes mean nothing to me. I came to power with a gun; only the gun can make me go.
It is wise for a colonizer to retreat quickly, but you have shown wisdom too late. First you must pay for your misdeeds.
Another step towards realizing the interests of the Somali people and their achievement of a better life.
